origin.identifier: https://asset-resources.gdevelop.io/public-resources/32x32 Fantasy Icons Pack v2/Icons/General Items/abbb10ef2f22cbd52212c0df5ac294376b5836039dc89740d5b7dc464aff4355_Flower Bulb_No Shadow.png
origin.name: Flower Bulb_No Shadow.png

content.text: Haven't seen you around here before! This place has been looking dull lately. We don't get that much people around here, so it's pretty hard to keep it fresh. Mind doing me a favor? You see this DEADBUSH right next to me-- could you go around the area and PICK THEM UP (press "e")? Come talk to me again if you ever get the chance to do so.
WOW! Looks to me that you've already cleaned up the area! Come meet me near the house at the BOTTOM LEFT, I'll fill you in on a couple things.
You get the feeling that you aren't ready to explore further...

Hello again! Thanks for cleaning up the area. I will be honored to be your first friend, and as you can see your happinness level increased! Do you feel the sadness in your heart being patched up? Don't be afraid to explore more areas. Some of my other friends are around here, maybe you could befriend them too!

There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
description: Reveal a text one letter after the other (a "typewriter" effect).
It can be used for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).
- The 3 behaviors has been merged into a unique one.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AutoTyping

events.comment: Temporary add the next word and check if it's adding a new line.

eventsFunctions.name: IsFinished

eventsFunctions.name: HasJustTyped

eventsFunctions.description: Restart typing from the beginning of text. The autotyping also start automatically when a new text is set for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: RestartFromBeginning
eventsFunctions.sentence: Restart typing from the beginning on _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Jump to a specific position in the text. Positions start at "0" and increase by one for every character.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpToPosition

eventsFunctions.name: ShowFullText

eventsFunctions.description: the time between characters beign typed.

propertyDescriptors.label: Detect if a new text character was just displayed
propertyDescriptors.name: CharacterJustAdded

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: BrakingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes for top-down.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScriptForTopDown

inlineCode: * Return the direction to use instead of the direction given in
// Forbid to turn before being aligned on the grid.
// Ensure sharp turn even with Verlet integrations.
* Called before the acceleration and new direction is applied to the
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Make as if the player had press button a bit longer to reach exactly
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
* Called before the velocity is applied to the object position and
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// Avoid rounding errors after a call to "separate" to make characters
// move indefinitely in front of a wall because they can't reach the cell.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IdleTracker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if an object has not moved (with some, customizable, tolerance) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
description: This behavior tracks the object position and provides a condition to check if the object has been around the same position for a certain amount of time. It's useful to track objects that are not moving (or very little, at least staying around a position).
* Add the behavior to your object.
* Configure the distance tolerance and the amount of time before considering objects idle.
* Use the conditions in your events to know when the object is idle (or when it has just moved).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Check if an object has not moved (with some tolerance, 20 pixels by default) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: IdleTracker

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just moved from its last position (using the tolerance configured in the behavior).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Has just moved from last position
eventsFunctions.name: HasMovedFromLastPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ has moved from its last position

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is idle: it has not moved from its last position (or within the tolerance) for the time configured in the behavior.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Time, in seconds, before considering the object as idle
propertyDescriptors.name: DurationBeforeIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance, in pixels, allowed for the object to travel and still be considered idle
propertyDescriptors.name: IdleDistanceTolerance
